skill.name: llm-evaluation
skill.description: Implement comprehensive evaluation strategies for LLM applications using automated metrics, human feedback, and benchmarking. Use when testing LLM performance, measuring AI application quality, or establishing evaluation frameworks.
skill.summary: Implement comprehensive evaluation strategies for LLM applications using automated metrics, human fe...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing no executable files or tooling. All content is static markdown with illustrative code examples. No data access, network activity, file writes, or command execution is possible. The skill provides evaluation guidance only.

content.value_statement: You need consistent ways to measure LLM quality and regressions. This skill provides metrics, human review guidance, and testing frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Lists automated metrics for generation, classification, and retrieval tasks
Defines human evaluation dimensions and annotation forms
Provides LLM-as-judge prompts for pointwise and pairwise scoring
Describes A/B testing with significance and effect sizes
Outlines benchmarking workflows and result aggregation
limitations: No runnable evaluation scripts are included in this directory
External libraries are required for example metric implementations
No datasets or benchmarks are bundled with the skill
No tool-specific integration steps are provided

use_cases.title: Regression gate in CI
use_cases.description: Design an evaluation checklist and thresholds to block model changes that reduce quality.

use_cases.title: Model comparison brief
use_cases.description: Compare two model options using human ratings and automated scores for a decision memo.

use_cases.title: Benchmark study plan
use_cases.description: Create a benchmarking plan with datasets, metrics, and reporting structure.

prompt_templates.title: Starter evaluation plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic evaluation plan with 3 automated metrics and 2 human criteria for a customer support chatbot.

prompt_templates.title: Metric selection guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend metrics for summarization, explain what each captures, and note one limitation per metric.

prompt_templates.title: LLM judge prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a pairwise LLM judge prompt to compare response A and B for accuracy, helpfulness, and clarity.

prompt_templates.title: A/B test analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a statistical testing plan for A/B evaluation, including sample size guidance and effect size reporting.

output_examples.input: Propose an evaluation plan for a RAG assistant.
output: Automated metrics: MRR, NDCG, Precision at K
LLM judge: pairwise comparison for final answers
Regression rule: fail if accuracy drops more than 5 percent

best_practices: Use multiple metrics and human review together
Test with representative and diverse data

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance is model agnostic and applies to Claude, Codex, Claude Code, and other LLMs.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples but no executable evaluation pipeline in this directory.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my stack?
faq.answer: Map the metrics and workflows to your existing evaluation or CI tools.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it is static documentation and does not read or transmit data.

faq.question: What if scores are unstable?
faq.answer: Increase sample size, review variance, and add human validation before decisions.

faq.question: How is this different from a benchmark list?
faq.answer: It combines metrics, human review, and testing strategy rather than only listing benchmarks.
